{"step_by_step_thinking": "The homunculus is a physical representation of the human body, located in the brain, in the primary somatosensory cortex. The size of different body parts in the homunculus is not proportional to their actual physical size, but rather to the amount of sensory or motor innervation they receive or to the degree of fine motor control they possess. Therefore, a larger area in the homunculus signifies increased precisiveness of movements.", "answer_choice": "C"}
